content.text: In this lesson, you'll learn how to ask a stranger for directions. We'll start with how to politely get someone's attention.
Using 's'il vous plaît' makes your questions much more polite.

data.tip: The 'r' sound is made in the back of your throat, similar to a light gargle.

content.title: Asking for Help
content.setting: You are in the city center and see someone who might be able to help you. You decide to approach them.

conversation_flow.title: Ask for the location of the train station
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Un peu. On peut parler en français.

content.text: Great start! Now let's learn the basic words you'll need to understand the directions you receive.

content.title: Understanding the Directions
content.setting: The person is now giving you directions to the train station.

conversation_flow.title: Acknowledge the first direction
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: La gare... c'est tout droit, et puis à gauche.

conversation_flow.title: Ask if it's far from here
Confirm the name of the street
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Non, c'est près. C'est la rue de la Paix.

content.text: Repeating directions back is a smart way to make sure you understood correctly. Let's learn how to do that and wrap up the conversation.

content.title: Finishing the Conversation
content.setting: You've understood the directions and now it's time to thank the person and leave.

conversation_flow.title: Repeat the directions to confirm
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Oui, c'est ça. La gare est à gauche.

conversation_flow.title: Thank the person for their help
Say goodbye and wish them a nice day
